sn20.8:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
sn20.8:4.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn20.8:5.1: “Mendicants, these days the Licchavis live using wood blocks as pillows, and they exercise diligently and keenly.
sn20.8:5.2: King Ajātasattu Vedehiputta of Magadha finds no vulnerability, he’s got no foothold.
sn20.8:5.3: But in the future the Licchavis will become delicate, with soft and tender hands and feet. They’ll sleep on soft beds with down pillows until the sun comes up.
sn20.8:5.4: King Ajātasattu Vedehiputta of Magadha will find a vulnerability, he’ll get his foothold.
sn20.8:6.1: These days the mendicants live using wood blocks as pillows, and they meditate diligently and keenly.
sn20.8:6.2: Māra the Wicked finds no vulnerability, and doesn’t get hold of them.
sn20.8:6.3: But in the future the mendicants will become delicate, with soft and tender hands and feet.
sn20.8:6.4: They’ll sleep on soft beds with down pillows until the sun comes up.
sn20.8:6.5: Māra the Wicked will find a vulnerability and get hold of them.
sn20.8:6.6: So you should train like this:
sn20.8:6.7: ‘We will live using wood blocks as pillows, and we will meditate diligently and keenly.’
